column4: I have a machine -- thats getting built into a firewall / router -- i would like to make positive sure which Nic is which -- is there a lilttle program to like blink the lights or something so i can for sure ID the machine?
oops - the nic
what model are the cards?
hold on let me check -- one is an intel i know for sure
ok good, try this:
sudo ethtool --blink eth0
or this actually, sudo ethtool -p eth0
nothing happening on the back of the box that i can see
try eth1
no such interface
you only have one nic?
what does ifconfig -a say?
it only shows eth0 and lo --
so it seems you have only one nic
my intel gigabit nic blinks when I use ethtool -p on the interface
ok - i'll keep fooling with it
the 2 other nics are belkin devices adn they are physically in the machine, but tehy do not show up in ubuntu at all
wireless?
are they listed in lspci?
in that case it sounds like the problem is not with ubuntu
sounds like a bios or hardware issue
that is strange
im gonna shut it down and pull them out then try putting them back
i got them now - -apparently they wanted a live connection before they would respond
